thread.title: Man believed to be morbidly obese learns of 130-pound tumor
thread.title_full: Man believed to be morbidly obese learns of 130-pound tumor

title: Man believed to be morbidly obese learns of 130-pound tumor
text:
Updated: 10:24 a.m. Friday, Feb. 17, 2017 | Posted: 10:24 a.m. Friday, Feb. 17, 2017 Man believed to be morbidly obese learns of 130-pound tumor Surgeons conduct an operation in this file photo. (Photo by Christopher Furlong/Getty Images) Related 
>> Read more trending stories 
The man’s surgeon believes that it was likely due to an ingrown hair that became infected. 
Roger Logan of Gulfport, Mississippi, said a tumor that hung between his legs was like hauling bags of cement around all day. 
“I used to equate it, you just put a strap around your neck and carry three bags of cement around with you all day long, just swinging,” Logan said. 
After numerous visits to doctors without getting new answers, Logan found Dr. Vipul Dev, who is based in California. 
Logan traveled from Mississippi to California, 2,000 miles and 40-plus hours in a car. 
On the road! Posted by Roger Logan on Saturday, January 28, 2017 
He said the trip was no different than being in his living room, where most of the time he sat in a recliner. 
The tumor, which was attached to his abdomen, was so big that it touched the floor when Logan sat. Doctor removes 130-pound tumor from Mississippi man
